content.description:
This is a link-up starting on

Black Fish

and finishing on

Nocturnal Animals

. Start in a right kneebar, trend leftward using lip holds, and tension to finish

NA

. Crimps, pinches, pockets, slopers, toe hooks, heel hooks, and foot cuts - it's got it all! Â The meat of the climbing is unique to this problem. The 'business' holds aren't used on either of the linked problems.
The higher start to Nocturnal Animals, starts on right sidepull and an undercling crimp. Squeeze your way to the top using trickery.
content.protection: 3 pads and a good spotter, aye.
content.location:
It is next to

Black Joe

.

content.description:
This is the sit to

Starfish Graveyard

. Start sitting at the big horizontal rail at the base of boulder (the same starting rail as

Black Joe

) on 2 crimps. Work your way into the compression rail, and go to the top of the boulder, losing the landing as you turn the lip. It is committing, hard, and thuggish. This is one of the best compression lines at The Reservoir.
content.protection: Pads and spotters who like you.
content.location:
It is on Black Joe Boulder and uses the same start as

Black Joe

.

content.description:
Climb the thin seam with a tough start to a break at 15'. From the break, climb a bit left.

For those with steel balls, break out the pads, and get down to some old school V5 highballing.
content.protection: Small cams and nuts. Due to the soft nature of the rock at North Quarry, it's advised to bring a few bouldering pads for the start even if you're leading it. Cams have been known to blow out on falls at the lower crux.
content.location:
Left of

Cinch

,  find the finger crack that hits a horizontal break 15' up.

content.description:
Start in the kneebar as for

Black Joe

or

52-50

, and climb straight up to the large rail feature. Traverse right until you reach the jug in the corner of the roof.

Reach to the next rail, and traverse back left. The crux is a big stab move to a relatively thin ledge. Top out!

Sit start on the waist-high slopey shelf just to the right of

Black Fish

. Traverse up and left with heel hooks and jugs, following the underside of the prow as you try not to dab on the adjacent slab.

For a slightly easier but still fun variation, you can throw out right to a jug about halfway through the climb, and top out on the slab.
content.location:
Begin just to the right of the start to

Black Fish

.

content.description:
While certainly not spectacular, this is a worthy route given the proximity to town.

The difficulty lies in navigating the right-facing rail at mid-height, in comparison to which the rest of the climbing is easy peasy lemon squeezy. Those not in the 6' club may find this hard for the grade.
content.protection: The rock quality could be better -- please be careful on the beginning!
content.location:
This is the center line on the wall, left of

Cinch

. It is easy to walk to the top and setup a TR if you want to work the moves before giving a lead attempt.

content.description: Cinch is a highball testpiece. Mantel, follow it by getting a sloping hold and a battle at an awkward dihedral, and pucker it up for the topout.
content.location: Begin just left of the furthest left hanging cable.

content.description:
Begin under the giant overhang to the south of

Black Fish

, but instead of questing out left through the prow, escape right to sloper rails at the lip. Continue up and left until you reach the good crack feature. Use it to mantel over.
content.location:
This is 10 feet south of

Black Fish

.

content.description:
Start low on the kneebar start of

52-50

, but instead move straight up the face after the jug sequence, using small crimps.

Start with your ass basically in the dirt low on two obvious crimps, get a kneebar in, and deadpoint to a good crimp, do a rose move, and follow your hands back to the crimps making your way over the wall with a jump or heelhook.
content.location:
This is on the backside of the Black Joe Boulder to the right of

Starfish Graveyard

.

content.description: Start low on a undercling rail. Using a kneebar, move out left to jugs before reaching the crimps out left, topping out the left side of the boulder over the rock slab landing. This was first done on a hot summer day with no pads.
content.location:
In Satanka Cove, walk around the North side until you see the boulder on the hillside. The boulder is large and obvious, and this line is just left of

Black Joe

.
